visualization_prompt: Generate a polar chart showing dual-pane directional data patterns using angular coordinate system interpolation
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two quantitative angular measurement series (8 data points each) representing electromagnetic signal characteristics. Synthetic data maintains domain validity: RF strength (μ=7.1, σ=2.3) follows normal distribution with intentional interference peaks, while noise floor (μ=7.4, σ=3.9) exhibits inverse correlation patterns. Dual polar coordinate systems were selected to enable simultaneous radial comparison of complementary wireless transmission metrics while conserving spatial relationships. Circular gridlines in the left pane (column series) optimize radial value perception per Tufte's principles, while polygonal interpolation in the right pane (area series) enhances angular pattern recognition through Cairo's continuity principles. Strategic color coding (blue for signal, red for noise) leverages pre-attentive processing while maintaining accessibility through distinct luminance values (ΔL=35).
